description:
WinUAE is an Amiga Emulator for the Windows platform. It started out as port of the Ubiquitous Amiga Emulator (UAE) and has evolved since then.

WinUAE (Windows UAE - Universal Amiga Emulator) is a free, open-source emulator that allows you to run software designed for the classic Commodore Amiga computers (like the A500, A1200, A4000) on modern Windows PCs.

Chipsets:
- A1000 original chipset
- OCS
- ECS (Agnus and/or Denise)
- AGA
- RTG (via Picasso 96)

CPU
- 68000
- 68010
- 68EC020
- 68020
- 68030
- 68040 (including EC/LC)
- 68060 (including EC/LC)
- PPC support

Memory
- Chip memory max 2M (real chipset limit), 8M (UAE only, 24-bit CPU), max 512M (UAE only, 32-bit CPU)
- Fast memory. 24-bit CPU max 8M, 32-bit CPU max 2G/3.5G (*)
- Model specific memory regions supported (“Slow RAM”, A3000/A4000 mainboard RAM etc)

Serial port
- Amiga native serial port to host serial port option. Only supports standard 7/8-bit serial protocols, 9-bit serial protocol is not supported by PC hardware.
- Supports all host serial-port like serial ports, bluetooth adapters etc.
- Connect two running WinUAE instances with emulated null modem cable.
- Serial port to TCP socket support.
- Telnet-like serial port to WinUAE log window support.
